To celebrate #TeacherAppreciationWeek, #GoogleEdu partnered with Sesame Workshop and #CCSSO on a new video series, pairing US National Teachers of the Year with Sesame Street characters to share messages of gratitude and celebrate the profession of teaching.
Learn more about the programs and tools Google continues to invest in to support educators and go behind the scenes with us on this initiative ‚Üí goo.gle/3YzBZ7b

Meet Okwus, a Mountain View-based technical recruiter at Google. Okwus has worked at Google for more than 8 years, and in that time he's developed scores of great advice for candidates applying to our technical roles. When asked for one of his top pieces of advice, Okwus advised candidates to brush up on their quantitative skills. "Counting and probability problems surround us. Spend some time before the interview refreshing your memory or learning the essentials of elementary probability theory and combinatorics."

Zooming out, Okwus was also able to share his more general guidance for the interview process. ‚ÄúYou should be able to verbalize and check any assumptions to ensure they are reasonable. This involves asking clarifying questions if you don‚Äôt understand the problem or need more information. Our engineers are looking to see how you engage the problem. Additionally, be sure to test your own code and ensure it‚Äôs easily readable without bugs. Find problems, write the code and solve them. Ultimately, there's no better way of practicing than actually writing these algorithms."

Get the rest of Okwus‚Äôs advice and additional guidance from our recruiting team here ‚Üí goo.gle/4jJ1iM4

Today's Teacher Appreciation Day #GoogleDoodle sends a thank-you to teachers, times infinity.

Comment below to say thank you to your favorite teacher ‚ù§Ô∏è
Shouting out some of our very impawtant co-workers, the Dooglers who keep us all company in and out of the office.¬† üêæ #LifeAtGoogle
12 days until #GoogleIO! üéâ Register at io.google and tune in on May 20 to watch live keynotes, announcements and more.

I really enjoyed my conversation with Steven Levitt about the impact of technology on learning and what that might mean for the future of education. His notion of a shift from 'just-in-case' to 'just-in-time' learning is a really interesting way to frame where AI can take us. Our conversation is here:

Get a behind the scenes look at our Color, Materials and Finish Room, where Google designers share how they made the new #Pixel9a feel premium in the hand and mesmerizing to the eye. Explore industrial design and UX opportunities at Google ‚Üí goo.gle/4iKvJAy

Meet Jelle, a growth specialist at Google Dublin, accelerating early-stage startups.

Jelle's passion lies in guiding innovative startups through business growth, advising them on their go-to-market strategy and ensuring they get the most leverage from their investments. As an Accelerated Growth Consultant, Jelle explains what it's like to have a front-row seat to these startups' scaling, "It's awesome seeing the sparkle in their eyes when founders dial in from their brand new office and introduce you to their newest hires because of this growth."

‚ÄúIn the fast-paced tech world, product knowledge can quickly become outdated. I see Google heavily investing in people who are experimental and passionate about new technologies. This focus on cultivating a growth mindset resonates deeply." 

Jelle has also found a community outside of his core work ‚Äî spending time exploring Ireland and, "every week, after work, I play soccer with our Google 'Tandix' team in the Irish league with teammates from all across Europe."

Join #LifeAtGoogle Dublin! ‚Üí goo.gle/3Xw10Q5

For more than a decade, we‚Äôve used AI to protect you from online scams. Today, we're releasing a new report on how we fight scams in Search, and sharing the new ways we're using AI to keep you safe across Search, Chrome and Android. Learn more ‚Üí https://goo.gle/44pwbAT

Meet Kathrin and her team. Kathrin's career journey spans from academia to Google for Education leadership. As a Director of Engineering, she guides teams building products like Google Classroom and Read Along, with an extra focus on infrastructure, safety and data insights. ‚ÄúWe place a big emphasis on working as a team,‚Äù she says, adding, ‚ÄúOn a daily basis, our engineers improve our product by writing code, designing new features or a better architecture to make our product scale.‚Äù

‚ÄúFor example, we allow teachers to give and grade assignments in Classroom, and at the same time build analytics and insights off of them. This can help teachers understand what material the students have mastered and what they still need to focus on.‚Äù

Her team‚Äôs recent expansion into Mexico City highlights the chance to make a meaningful difference in the region. ‚ÄúI love that I can work with an incredible team and apply my skills to an area I care so much about, and that impacts millions of students, teachers and education leaders around the world,‚Äù she says.

Join #LifeAtGoogle Mexico City ‚Üí goo.gle/3AIVhhJ

Google and YouTube are committed to supporting the greater Los Angeles community as it recovers from this year's devastating wildfires.

As part of this commitment, Google.org will help provide essential resources to students and educators through the Greater Los Angeles Education Foundation to help impacted students stay connected to their education.

Rebuilding will be a long-term effort. We‚Äôre proud to help greater Los Angeles students continue their learning and support the community's recovery as a whole. Learn more here: https://goo.gle/42OySJX

Attention rising 2L law students ‚öñÔ∏è  ‚Äî The Google Legal Summer Institute is accepting applications for our 2026 program! LSI Scholars will spend a week at Google, then head off to a paid summer associateship with one of our partner law firms. Learn more ‚Üí goo.gle/41VdlQv

Honoured to be on the #TIME100 list and cover - and congratulations to all the other people featured. Thank you to the brilliant Jennifer Doudna, founder of the Innovative Genomics Institute, for the lovely writeup.

A day in the life of Kyle, a Software Engineer at Google Warsaw, includes meetings, coding, debugging, customer support and community involvement. As a tech lead on his project, Kyle‚Äôs passionate about helping new Googlers, hosting interns and organizing events. 

He explains of his work at our growing Warsaw office, ‚ÄúI'm glad my job isn't a predictable routine, and I'm especially happy that I get to own a project so early on.‚Äù

Kyle‚Äôs advice? ‚ÄúJust apply! Nothing changes if you fail, and you can always try again.‚Äù

Check out open roles in Warsaw and beyond ‚Üí goo.gle/3Dr1ksn #LifeAtGoogle

Two Googlers on our recruiting team ‚Äî Okwus and Jules ‚Äî cover the skills you should know before your interview for a technical role at Google. Watch the full video here ‚Üí goo.gle/4htXwp8
Bring your ideas to life as cinematic videos with Veo 2, rolling out today in Gemini Advanced. Here‚Äôs how ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4cCev7h
‚ÄúThe goal would be to one day speak Dolphin.‚Äù üê¨ The Wild Dolphin Project and Google DeepMind are using AI to make waves in interspecies communication. Learn more here ‚Üí goo.gle/3G8z5jr

Today‚Äôs Google Doodle celebrates World Quantum Day by exploring the principles of quantum mechanics using thaumatropes ‚Äî a simple optical illusion ‚Äî to illustrate the complex concept of superposition. Learn more about the future of quantum computing ‚Üí  https://goo.gle/4cwzlof

Ready to work smarter, not harder? AI is transforming the way we work ‚Äî from boosting productivity and creativity to delivering real business transformation and impact. Here's a look at some of the biggest news from #GoogleCloudNext. Click through to get all the details ‚Üí goo.gle/3RaMPMQ
Meet the Android team and learn about new experiences coming to Android. Set a reminder for The Android Show: I/O edition on Tuesday May 13 and be the first in the know ¬†‚Üì

"Ever since I was a kid, I had a deep passion for computers and ethical hacking. That passion fueled my journey to Google, where I now get to do what I love every day while helping secure Google‚Äôs products,‚Äù says Yousif.

Meet Yousif, a Security Engineer on Google‚Äôs Enterprise Infrastructure Protection team. ‚ÄúEvery day, I work with incredibly talented colleagues and develop cutting-edge technologies that protect Google‚Äôs systems and services. I also work closely with software engineers to proactively find and fix vulnerabilities across Google‚Äôs entire product suite, helping make our products safer for billions of users worldwide,‚Äù he adds.

His work involves staying ahead of emerging cyber threats, mastering hacking techniques, and diving deep into the inner workings of computer systems. ‚ÄúPlus, proficiency in coding and expertise in designing and building scalable systems are essential,‚Äù he shares.

Explore #LifeAtGoogle and discover how you can contribute to secure Google products ‚Üí goo.gle/3DAhPTf

You‚Äôre invited to Google Marketing Live on May 21, 2025! Get a virtual front-row seat to groundbreaking ad innovations across Google and YouTube ‚Äî where discovery starts and decisions are made.

Register for #GML2025 today ‚û°Ô∏è https://goo.gle/4ieVGIf

When his son was diagnosed with a rare disease, Googler Thomas Wagner used Gemini to bridge the gap between complex research papers and the scientists leading the work. üî¨

üß† He was able to better understand the science behind Alexander disease (AxD) by breaking down dense scientific works, genetic explanations, and medical articles into understandable terms.

‚û°Ô∏è This knowledge then helped him to see connections between different research areas and consider how they might apply to AxD. 

‚ùîHe was able to come up with better questions for those working on treatments ‚Äî and his efforts mean 11 research groups who hadn‚Äôt worked on AxD before are now beginning to do so. 

His story is a powerful reminder of why we work on AI. ‚Üì
#Dooglers: Bringing pawsitive vibes and boosted productivity, one paw at a time! üêæüê∂! #LifeAtGoogle

What does a day in the life of a Customer Engineer at Google looks like? Meet Vishakha, who says, ‚ÄúI thrive on understanding the ‚Äòwhy‚Äô behind challenges and developing ‚Äòthe what‚Äô to address them.‚Äù

From designing Google Cloud solutions to explaining complex tech and building proof-of-concepts, her role is a blend of technical expertise and collaboration. ‚ÄúIn a nutshell, I‚Äôm the main tech contact, bridging the gap between sales, customers and our product teams,‚Äù she explains. 

Vishakha offers this advice for those applying to a similar role: ‚ÄúBuild actual solutions, even small ones, to demonstrate your skills‚Äù and ‚Äúpractice explaining technical concepts to non-technical individuals‚Ä¶The ability to translate complex technical concepts into tangible business value is where you truly shine.‚Äù

Get a glimpse into #LifeAtGoogle and explore open Customer Engineer roles ‚Üí goo.gle/43GK1hG

This week, the first satellite for the FireSat constellation, a first-of-its-kind network of over 50 satellites designed to use AI to detect and track wildfires when they‚Äôre still small, reached the skies on the SpaceX Transporter-13 mission. üõ∞Ô∏è Once complete, FireSat will help firefighters act quickly before devastation spreads ‚Äî and the satellite data will contribute to a global historical record, so scientists can better model and understand wildfire behavior. 

Learn more about this collaboration between Google Research, Muon Space, Earth Fire Alliance, Moore Foundation and wildfire authorities ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3FCTfl7

Photos: SpaceX

As we celebrate 20 years of Google Maps üó∫Ô∏è, we're sharing the story of Ben Luk, one of the engineers who helped launch Maps in Hong Kong back in 2008.

"It started as a 20% project with a few fellow Hong Kong engineers," Ben recalls. "We wanted to bring accessibility and connectivity to the city we grew up in. It was fascinating to see Hong Kong's unique density and community-centric buildings through the lens of mapping. Ensuring accuracy was paramount, particularly with building names and the precise locations of MTR station exits ‚Äì details that are vital in our daily lives."

Ben's dedication didn't stop there. He's now a Level-9 Local Guide, driven by the pride he feels when navigating his city with Maps. "Seeing the impact firsthand fuels my passion," he says. "I'm just 8,000 points away from Level 10!" Ben shares with a smile. "Every contribution counts, and I'm excited to keep exploring and sharing my love with the community."

We've even unearthed footage of Ben hosting a Google Maps demo in Hong Kong back then! Check out this video to see how far we've come ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3QufWug

Join us in celebrating 20 years of mapping and the dedication of people like Ben who make it all possible.

Meet Arthi, a Seattle-based software engineer working to ensure efficient data delivery for Google Cloud. ‚ÄúAs a SWE, a lot of my role involves writing and running tests to verify that the virtual machines created in Google Cloud have their network control paths set up correctly."

Initially, Arthi had some hesitation about a career in software engineering. ‚ÄúIt can sometimes be hard to visualize your impact when you're writing lines of code or reviewing documents,‚Äù she explained. ‚ÄúI'm a pretty social person who loves to solve problems, so I like getting to know people and learning about their lives, and then trying to come up with solutions to make their lives even just a tiny bit easier.‚Äù Luckily for Arthi, when she arrived at Google ‚Äî first as a summer intern, and then as a full-time employee ‚Äî she discovered that this desire to help the user was baked into every step of the process.

Thank you for all you do for #LifeAtGoogle Arthi! Explore our open roles and opportunities https://goo.gle/4fLm38J

Today, developers can start building with Gemini 2.5 Flash, now in preview in the Gemini API in Google AI Studio and Vertex AI. It‚Äôs also available to everyone in the Gemini App. 

Gemini 2.5 Flash is our fast, cost-efficient thinking model. üß† It‚Äôs our first hybrid reasoning model, so the model adapts the amount that it thinks based on the prompt.

With 2.5 Flash in preview, developers can also control how much the model reasons so people can optimize across quality, cost, and latency. We can‚Äôt wait to see how developers put Gemini 2.5 Flash to work in your apps ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4cCMTyN

üö® First Pixel Drop of the year üö®
Starting today, new helpful updates are coming to Pixel, including updated Scam Detection, more ways to use Gemini and better options for staying connected.

At #GoogleCloudNext, L‚ÄôOr√©al, Intuit, Deutsche Bank and more shared how generative AI is helping them work smarter and get more done. Learn more about how AI is changing the future of work ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4lrN4kn
The new #Pixel9a is here and available today! We‚Äôre excited for you to experience what we‚Äôve been working on¬† ‚Üí goo.gle/3Edj5vS

Meet Faz, the partnerships expert who‚Äôs bringing Google‚Äôs AI to the world.

From negotiating high-value deals to collaborating on AI integrations, Faz is on the forefront of Google‚Äôs partnerships. As Director of Emerging & Enterprise Partnerships, she drives strategic collaborations across the Gemini, G1, Enterprise, and TV teams.

‚ÄúI work closely with partners to integrate AI into their consumer offerings, and I leverage it daily to enhance my own work,‚Äù says Faz. ‚ÄúIt is clear that AI will unlock new opportunities, and I truly believe that AI can empower everyone to work smarter and boost efficiency.‚Äù

Faz‚Äôs words of wisdom for future Googlers? ‚ÄúEvery step you take is an opportunity to grow, learn, and redefine what success means to you,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúRemember, your journey is unique ‚Äì walk it with intention, resilience, and confidence, knowing that every step truly counts.‚Äù

Start your #LifeAtGoogle journey today ‚Üí goo.gle/3Ebyc8z

Join us for #GoogleCloudNext from April 9-11, online and in Las Vegas ‚Üí goo.gle/CloudNext25

Register now for a complimentary digital pass to catch all our new announcements, plus strategies and tools to help you build the next big thing.

Introducing Gemini 2.5, our most intelligent AI model. 

Our first release, an experimental version of 2.5 Pro, unlocks state-of-the-art performance in math and science. üî•

Learn more about Gemini‚Äôs latest leap ‚Üì

‚ÄúFrom a young age, I was always fascinated by how things worked. I was the kid who loved solving logical puzzles, and this natural curiosity led me to pursue a B. Tech in college, where I got the incredible opportunity to intern at Google.‚Äù That‚Äôs Megha Agarwal, a Hyderabad-based software engineer. Now a full time Googler, Megha is working on Cloud‚Äôs backup and disaster recovery team, helping businesses protect their important data by creating backups. ‚ÄúThink of it like an insurance policy for all their digital files,‚Äù she explained.

For Megha, the ability to work with cutting-edge technology at Google was a big draw. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs exhilarating to be at the forefront of innovation and see where the future of tech is headed.‚Äù Beyond the work itself, Megha also enjoys collaborating with fellow Googlers. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the people who truly make this place special. The team is full of talented, passionate, and supportive individuals who inspire me every day.‚Äù

Thank you for all you do Megha! Visit our Careers site to explore our open roles and opportunities for students and early career professionals ‚û°Ô∏è https://goo.gle/4fLm38J

Meet Mohsin: a Bengaluru-based technical program manager at Google! ‚ÄúThink of me as the conductor of an orchestra, making sure all the different parts work together in harmony to create beautiful music... except instead of music, it's the Cloud,‚Äù Mohsin explained. ‚ÄúI juggle lots of different projects, keep teams organized, and make sure everything gets done on time.‚Äù

Mohsin‚Äôs journey to Google was winding. After graduating from university with a computer science degree, he applied to Google multiple times before finally landing his role. For Mohsin, this persistence was well worth it ‚Äî ‚ÄúI‚Äôve always been drawn to Google‚Äôs mission of not just changing technology, but changing how we live our lives.‚Äù And for Mohsin, ‚Äúgeeking out on hands-on stuff like 3D printers, laser cutting, and electronics labs is an added bonus.‚Äù

Thank you for your contributions to #lifeatGoogle Mohsin! Explore our open roles and opportunities ‚û°Ô∏è https://goo.gle/4fLm38J

Hello, Las Vegas! Had a great time this morning on stage at #GoogleCloudNext where we unveiled our 7th-gen TPU, Ironwood, purpose-built for inference and with massive gains (3,600x performance and 29x better energy efficiency our first Cloud TPU. It‚Äôs coming later this year!)

We also announced that Cloud Wide Area Network, based on Google‚Äôs own global-scale network, is coming soon too. And we launched new features in Google Agentspace that make it easier to create and adopt agents, as well as Gemini 2.5 Flash, our low-latency and most cost-efficient model with ‚Äúthinking‚Äù built-in - coming soon in AI Studio, Vertex + Gemini app. 

AI enables powerful new capabilities, but the most exciting part is what people do with them. 

I saw an incredible example of that last night at Las Vegas Sphere, where we gave a sneak peek into how AI is helping to enrich the Wizard of Oz experience coming to the Sphere later this year. Google‚Äôs been working with visual effects artists around the world and our AI models to effectively bring the film‚Äôs original characters to a whole new life for 2025. We‚Äôre a company full of engineers, problem solvers‚Ä¶and movie buffs. So the prospect of introducing a classic American film to an entirely new generation was an exciting one!
More details on everything we announced at Cloud Next here:¬†https://lnkd.in/eiTnBBp3

Meet Eden: a customer solutions engineer based in our Atlanta office. After graduating with a degree in computer science, Eden joined Google in our Cloud Technical Residency (CTR) program: our full-time rotational program within Google Cloud. "When I was applying for jobs, I found the CTR program appealing because I would be placed in a cohort of other new grads all acclimating to corporate life together," Eden explained. "I'd also heard that Google's culture emphasizes community, collaboration, and creativity." In her current role, Eden provides technical advice, guidance, best practices, and optimization techniques to startups that use Cloud, ensuring they're equipped to build successfully on our platform. In Eden's words, "working with these customers is my favorite part of the job!"

Thank you for your contributions to #lifeatGoogle Eden! Explore opportunities and open roles for students and early career professionals ‚û°Ô∏è https://goo.gle/4fLm38J

Great to see Alphabet / Google at the top of this list. I've always thought the best "perk" of the company is my fellow Googlers - brilliant, innovative, and entirely focused on making helpful things for our users and customers. Just a few weeks shy of my 21st (!) Googleversary and still feeling lucky.

https://lnkd.in/eJ9DaDKF

Excited to see LinkedIn named Google #1 on its 2025 Top Companies in the U.S. list! It's an honor to be ranked alongside the world's most innovative companies each year, highlighting some of the ways we're helping Googlers grow their careers.¬†Huge thanks to all of the Googlers who make this such an exceptional place to work day in and day out. So proud!

One of our favorite things about going into office is all the Dooglers who join us! üê∂ Recently, Googlers in the UK office put together a ‚Äúcompetition‚Äù to honor them. Spoiler alert - everyone‚Äôs a winner. #LifeAtGoogle

Meet Jordyn H.: A Washington D.C.-based UX designer on Google Chrome‚Äôs security team. ‚ÄúMy role is focused on creating safe and intuitive online experiences for users,‚Äù Jordyn explained. ‚ÄúThis means I design clear interfaces and interactions that help people confidently navigate the web and avoid security risks.‚Äù Jordyn is particularly interested in this work because she believes a safer and more navigable internet will help people discover the possibilities of technology. ‚ÄúBy breaking down barriers and simplifying complex digital systems, we can unlock a world of opportunities for everyone.‚Äù 

For Jordyn, Google is the right place to pursue this mission. ‚ÄúGoogle provides the perfect platform to collaborate with incredibly talented people and make a difference on a large scale.‚Äù Interested in similar work? Check out our open roles and opportunities ‚û°Ô∏è https://goo.gle/4fLm38J

Meet Marilene, a Software Engineering Manager at Google Brazil.

Marilene leads a team of engineers tackling some of the most complex challenges in Search technology. From processing data to developing innovative new features, her work impacts millions of users every day.

‚ÄúI find immense satisfaction in seeing the products I‚Äôve helped design and build come to fruition, impacting the lives of countless people around the world,‚Äù says Marilene.

Reflecting on her Google journey, Marilene has some words of encouragement for aspiring Googlers. ‚ÄúJust apply!‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt be discouraged if you don‚Äôt fit all the requirements perfectly.‚Äù

Ready to start your #LifeAtGoogle? Discover open roles at Google Brazil ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3D9UFTd

Welcome to Ananta, our newest Google campus in Bengaluru. As one of our largest campuses, Ananta showcases our commitment to future-forward workspaces and India‚Äôs digital transformation.  From its "neighborhood" layout to elements like 100% wastewater recycling and the "Aranya" forest walk, every detail was built to foster collaboration, innovation and sustainability. Explore opportunities and join one of the many growing teams at Ananta ‚Üí goo.gle/4aUkWla

Pamela, a senior software engineer at Google Brazil, thrives on collaboration. And as part of the Search Quality team, she‚Äôs experienced firsthand the power of the Googler spirit.

‚ÄúGooglers are the real game changers,‚Äù she says, emphasizing how the ‚Äúamazing and smart people‚Äù create a supportive environment where everyone can thrive. This collaborative atmosphere inspired her to join Google in 2021, driven by a desire to ‚Äúchallenge myself into learning new things and creating products for billions of people!‚Äù

Her days are a mix of designing solutions, coding, collaborating, and ‚Äústudying a lot,‚Äù she says, highlighting the continuous learning that‚Äôs integral to her role.

Ready to experience #LifeAtGoogle? Explore open roles at Google Brazil ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3D9UFTd

How it started: Google‚Äôs Mexico City office was built in 2013, with just a few engineers and a drive to expand. 

How it‚Äôs going: A couple of miles from Mexico City‚Äôs downtown, our Montes Urales headquarters is located inside a seven-story vibrant building, which combines both traditional and contemporary art from Mexico and serves as a hub for several teams including Sales, Cloud, Engineering, Marketing, and more!

Explore #LifeAtGoogle opportunities at Google Mexico City ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3AIVhhJ

As we gear up for a new year of growth and opportunities, Jason ‚Äî a Tokyo-based product strategy & operations manager at Google ‚Äî shared his top takeaways from moving around often in his career. After reading through his reflections, explore our open roles and opportunities at Google ‚û°Ô∏è https://goo.gle/4fLm38J

Meet Bee, a Google Cloud Technical Account Manager who‚Äôs passionate about empowering clients. From optimizing cloud infrastructure to troubleshooting complex technical issues, Bee is a problem-solver who goes above and beyond for her clients. 

‚ÄúI see myself as a trusted advisor,‚Äù says Bee.

As a member of both the Black at Google and Women Techmakers employee resource groups, Bee is also passionate about giving back. She volunteers at events like AfroTech, sharing her expertise and inspiring others in the tech community.

And when it comes to teamwork, Bee knows its value firsthand. ‚ÄúComing back from maternity leave? My team was incredible, helping me get back up to speed so fast, I almost felt like I‚Äôd gained superpowers‚Ä¶or at least regained my ability to drink a hot cup of coffee.‚Äù

Ready to make an impact like Bee? Explore open #LifeAtGoogle careers ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3CqL5L7

Thinking about your next career move? You‚Äôre not alone ‚Äî on average, people change careers 5 to 7 times.  Meet Career Dreamer, our new AI experiment from #GrowWithGoogle. Explore careers personalized to your skills and interests ‚Üí goo.gle/3Xb51ZT

Nicky‚Äôs Google journey has taken her across the world ‚Äî from Buenos Aires to Mountain View, and Bogot√° to Miami. Now leading deals & packages for Spanish-speaking Latin America, she leads the charge in crafting and executing strategies to drive commercial deals, providing ‚Äústrategic solutions and benefits that help our advertisers and partners grow.‚Äù

Outside of her core work, Nicky‚Äôs also a leader in the Women@Google community, empowering women across Latin America to celebrate their achievements and reach their full potential.

Nicky‚Äôs secrets to success after nearly 10 years at Google? Learn, live, grow, and connect. ‚ÄúTogether, we achieve more and better things,‚Äù she says.

Ready to start your own #LifeAtGoogle adventure? Find your perfect role ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3CqL5L7

You can now use Google Lens to search your screen on iOS, in Chrome or in the Google app. Draw, highlight or tap to quickly search what you see, whether you‚Äôre reading an article, shopping or even watching a video. Learn more ‚Üí goo.gle/417Zepm

Want to learn more about Google‚Äôs hiring process? Here are some resume tips:
‚úÖ Tailor your resume to the job you‚Äôre applying to. 
‚úÖ When listing your accomplishments, try to use this framing: Accomplished [X] as measured by [Y] by doing [Z]
‚úÖ Keep it short ‚Äî ideally 1 page, although 2 is okay.

Click through for the full video, which shares more details about our hiring process ‚Äî including examples of real Googlers solving sample technical interview questions  ‚û°Ô∏è https://goo.gle/4htXwp8

We always celebrate our incredible #Dooglers. But this December, we want to honor our #ServiceDogs with #LifeAtGoogle‚Äôs Disability Alliance and all the incredible service #Dooglers who work alongside their #Googlers! Meet Lori Zhou, a software engineer on YouTube's live foundation team. "In my role, I'm working on the backend systems that allow livestreaming on YouTube," she explained. Lori's exposure to #lifeatGoogle started in 2019, when she attended a Google-led workshop on campus. "I've always been interested in building new technology, so it has been a goal of mine to work here ever since." After completing a master‚Äôs degree and a career change, Lori's dream has become a reality! Her favorite part of working at Google? "Definitely the people. I've met so many incredibly smart and supportive colleagues. I'm constantly learning and growing, and it's such a rewarding feeling to see my progress and contribute to something meaningful."

Thank you for your contributions to #lifeatGoogle, Lori!

Los Angeles is the heart of entertainment and storytelling and has an impact on culture all over the world. It‚Äôs also where many YouTube creators, artists, partners and our employees call home. Like so many, we‚Äôve been heartbroken by the devastation from the wildfires and want to do our part to support the community as it rebuilds. 

Together with Google.org, YouTube and Google are contributing $15 million to organizations providing immediate relief in LA, including Emergency Network Los Angeles, American Red Cross, the Center for Disaster Philanthropy and the Institute for Nonprofit News. And Google is providing accurate and timely information to LA through products and services like Google Search, Google Maps and Waze. 

When it‚Äôs safe to reopen our offices in LA, we plan to offer YouTube production facilities to impacted creators and artists as they begin to recover and rebuild their businesses. In the coming months, we‚Äôll also host a number of events to bring the YouTube creative community together - making space to connect and share resources.

On the long road ahead, we‚Äôll continue to support recovery and rebuilding efforts alongside our partners across the industry. In moments like these, we see the power of communities coming together to support each other - and the strength and resilience of the YouTube community is like no other.
What‚Äôs the best career advice you‚Äôve received from a colleague? #LifeAtGoogle

Looking for a new career path? Discover career opportunities at our Mexico City office! Our Montes Urales headquarters is in a lively seven-story building with spaces specially designed as a place to work, to collaborate, to innovate, and to share.

ADCOLOR 2024 ‚Äî a conference celebrating the contributions of people of color working in tech and media ‚Äî wrapped up last week in Los Angeles! Each year, the conference identifies people of color who‚Äôve gone above and beyond to make a difference in the world of marketing and technology. This year, 6 Googlers were nominated for awards: Maryam Ikuforiji (product marketing manager), Layla Jawad (product marketing manager), Debby Erazo (product marketing manager), Gia Cummings (account manager), Olivia Hoeft (marketing manager), and Adrienne Hayes (VP of global subscriptions & customer growth marketing).

While the specifics of each Googlers‚Äô accomplishments vary, they all worked to promote diverse perspectives into their work. ‚ÄúI collaborate with teams across Google and YouTube to showcase diverse narratives and perspectives on our social media platforms," Debby explained. "This involves highlighting a wide range of stories, from exciting new local businesses featured on our Google Small Business channels to celebrating the achievements of diverse creators on our YouTube Advertisers handles. By leveraging the reach of Google products, we can amplify these voices and contribute to a more inclusive and representative online space."

Congratulations to all of Google‚Äôs ADCOLOR 2024 nominees!

Meet Khulan, a Solutions Consultant & Designer for AI on the Google Cloud team. She‚Äôs worked in London and NYC, helping people get the most out of Google Cloud.

‚ÄúI work alongside amazing teams to design innovative solutions ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs crafting user experiences for complex applications or architecting cutting-edge AI infrastructure,‚Äù Khulan explains. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs incredibly rewarding to see the ways we‚Äôre helping businesses transform and grow with Google Cloud.‚Äù

Beyond her impactful work, Khulan has also been involved in the Asian Googler Network. ‚ÄúThis community has been such a source of strength for me,‚Äù she shares. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not just about connecting with people who share similar cultural backgrounds; it‚Äôs about creating a space where we can all support each other, share experiences, and empower one another.‚Äù

Apply for open roles and learn more about #LifeAtGoogle today ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3CqL5L7

You may have seen some of our recent progress at Google Research on quantum computing that we published in Nature ‚Ä¶https://lnkd.in/gVGxFwA8

... earlier this week my colleagues Charina Chou, Hartmut Neven and I shared our perspective in Foreign Affairs Magazine on what lies ahead in quantum computing and why we believe progress in quantum has profound implications for national security, the global economy, and scientific progress. 

While many of the practical applications of quantum computing will be achieved years, if not decades, in the future, the race for quantum progress is happening now ‚Äì and with so much more still to do. The groundwork we lay now will determine if we are able to fully realize its potential benefits for agriculture and food production, treatment of disease, materials, energy and more, while addressing its risks. 

You can read our perspective here: https://lnkd.in/gd3fZYtB (note, while Foreign Affairs has a paywall, you‚Äôre able to read the full article by sharing your email address with them.)

Meet Anisha: a new grad software engineer working to optimize Google Cloud‚Äôs data center efficiency. ‚ÄúI work on a service called ‚Äòpower capping, which allows us to power our services,‚Äù Anisha explained. ‚ÄúMy role involves developing and maintaining the software that drives this power capping service, ensuring it‚Äôs reliable, scalable, and effective in supporting our growing infrastructure needs.‚Äù Before becoming a full-time Googler, Anisha spent a summer interning at Google. After converting to full time, she shared her thoughts on the process, the differences between interning and working full time, and her advice!

Meet Vlad: a Bucharest-based software engineer working on the Fitbit mobile app. For Vlad, the opportunity to help build a product used by millions of people is one of the main reasons he was initially interested in working at Google. ‚ÄúI applied to Google because I knew it‚Äôs a place where you can have a global impact by coding and developing tools used by so many people (including myself),‚Äù Vlad explained. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs amazing to speak with your family, friends, or even random people on the street and see that they‚Äôre using something you developed. This type of reward is what makes Google such a special place to work.‚Äù

Explore our opportunities for students and early career professionals ‚û°Ô∏è https://goo.gle/3yp5COl

Google is celebrating #InternationalMentoringDay and we hope you are, too! Whether you‚Äôre just starting your mentorship journey or taking the next step, we hope you‚Äôll join Googlers around the world in thanking a mentor who has made a difference. 

Bonus points: Share a story of a mentor who has made an impact in your life and tag them in a comment below!

Google‚Äôs Genesis program is our rotational program for new grads interested in finance. In the words of Brandon, a current member of the program, ‚ÄúGenesis is designed to equip you with the skills and experiences you need to thrive in the world of finance at Google. It's like a finance bootcamp, but way more fun!‚Äù Members of the Genesis program rotate through various areas of corporate finance ‚Äî working on everything from creating financial models for product teams, to collaborating with stakeholders on process improvements. ‚ÄúThe best part though,‚Äù Brandon explained, ‚Äúis that early in your career, you get the chance to gain insights into how a company like Google operates ‚Äî all while developing crucial leadership and problem-solving skills.‚Äù

For Jessica, another Genesis Googler, what happens outside her core role is just as important as the skills learned in it. ‚ÄúWhat I value most about the Genesis program is the strong sense of community. Starting your career alongside a cohort of peers creates a safe space to navigate the challenges we face as young professionals.‚Äù

Learn more and apply today ‚û°Ô∏è https://goo.gle/4hruzdM

Augustine is not only a Product Strategy and Operations lead for YouTube‚Äôs Core Experiences team, he‚Äôs also passionate about fostering diversity and inclusion at Google.

‚ÄúI founded and still lead the Black in Product Operations community and serve as a facilitator for our new Black employees onboarding program called The Collective,‚Äù Augustine says. He is also an active member of numerous other employee resource groups, including Black@ YouTube, the Black Googler Network, and Africans@ Google. ‚ÄúThese communities have been incredibly valuable to me, offering a strong sense of belonging and opportunities for leadership development,‚Äù he adds.

In his day-to-day role, Augustine helps teams track their progress. ‚ÄúThis involves managing performance reporting, developing tools and dashboards to monitor key metrics, and collaborating with teams to ensure successful launches,‚Äù Augustine explains.

Augustine's biggest takeaway since joining Google? ‚ÄúThe power individuals have to create positive change, both within their roles and in the broader community.‚Äù

Meet Cristhian ‚Äî as head of Global Trade Operations at Google‚Äôs London office, he leads a team from all across the world. 

‚ÄúOur mission is to enable the importation, exportation, and distribution of Google‚Äôs branded products such as Pixel, Fitbit, and Nest devices,‚Äù he explains. ‚ÄúI spend most of my day brainstorming ideas with multiple teams about how to design effective cross-border supply chains to take our cool gadgets to the hands of our users.‚Äù

Cristhian is also the former lead for the UK chapter of HOLA, the Hispanic Googler Network, and still spearheads various projects to ‚Äúpromote cultural, education, and social impact initiatives ‚Ä¶ like providing free training and hosting Google HOLA London Tech Week, a conference for Latinx startups.‚Äù

His duties, combined with finding an ‚Äúextended family‚Äù in HOLA, led Cristhian to a powerful realization during his eight years at Google. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs all about people,‚Äù he reflects. ‚ÄúGreat performance and mastering specific skills are really good, but in the end, it all comes to your relationships with people.‚Äù
	
Interested in joining our community and living the #LifeAtGoogle? Visit our careers site ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3YuTrdr

Meet Charan R: a Bengaluru-based data analytics apprentice. ‚ÄúIn my role, I work as a bridge between my stakeholders and my technical skills,‚Äù Charan explained. ‚ÄúIn other words, I understand business problems and create technological solutions.‚Äù For the most part, this process involves taking complex data and making it much easier to understand. ‚ÄúI bring numbers to life by sharing them in visual formats, and I communicate my thoughts through the art of storytelling to connect with any kind of audience.‚Äù

Despite his current analytics-oriented work, Charan studied electronics in college ‚Äî with data science electives sprinkled in. Now at Google, one of Charan's favorite perks is the ability to continue developing interests outside his core role. ‚ÄúThere are so many workshops and learning resources available to upskill me not only in my current work, but also across other domains.‚Äù
What‚Äôs one helpful piece of advice that a manager or supervisor has given you? #LifeAtGoogle

‚ÄúI joined Google to ensure our artificial intelligence can see people like me.‚Äù Meet Auriel, a product lead in Google DeepMind. Auriel‚Äôs core work centers around ensuring AI products are accessible and effective for a wide range of users. ‚ÄúFor Detection AI products like Pixel Camera, I make sure that the computer can recognize as many users as possible,‚Äù she explained. ‚ÄúFor Generative AI products like Gemini, I help build features that keep users safe and improve the quality of the image depictions.‚Äù

For Auriel, her interest in this work was sparked long before she arrived at Google. While completing her computer science capstone research paper in college ‚Äî where she aimed to detect her heart rate using video signals ‚Äî Auriel encountered a challenge due to the established model‚Äôs inability to register her darker skin tone. ‚ÄúNone of my creations could detect my own heart rate accurately, but they could detect my lighter skin toned friends ‚Äì it was really frustrating." Eventually, she solved the issue by creating her own detection model, and this experience ignited her passion for addressing fairness challenges in machine learning.

Thank you Auriel for making our products and #lifeatGoogle more fair. Join Auriel and the team in their mission to shape a more equitable future in machine learning. ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4dOU9q4

Thank you to the 12,832 Googlers who participated in the 5k, and 1,042 Googler volunteers who helped organize races in their cities. The initiative has raised over ‚Ç¨7,114 for Action Against Hunger so far, an organization that‚Äôs pushing back against the predictable, preventable, and treatable problem of hunger around the world.

Thank you to everyone who joined us and made this event possible! #LifeAtGoogle

For Stephanie Nuesi ‚Äî a financial analyst based in Google‚Äôs Chicago office ‚Äî working at Google wasn‚Äôt exactly a surprise. ‚ÄúI was born and raised in the Dominican Republic and came to the U.S. in 2015. My journey with Google started a few years later in 2018, when I saw a Google office from afar, pointed at it, and told my mom I would work there one day. Two years later, I called her to tell her I got a job offer from Google.‚Äù

Outside of her main role as a financial analyst, Stephanie also serves as the VP of Marketing for HOLA Finance: our employee resource group for Latinx finance Googlers. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm tasked with ensuring all our Latinx talent in Finance at Google learn about the different resources available to help them grow professionally.‚Äù Additionally, Stephanie volunteers at the Association of Latino Professionals for America, and mentors students from across Latin America. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs important for me to give back to the community and help our Latinx Googler community become the next leaders of tomorrow.‚Äù

As we celebrate #HispanicHeritageMonth, we‚Äôre sharing some of the advice that Stephanie shares with anyone interested in following her footsteps!

Ravin, a Los Angeles-based data scientist with Google Labs, spoke at NeurIPS about his team‚Äôs work to build NotebookLM: a personalized AI research assistant. Ravin‚Äôs talk covered the process of building the product, and the technical challenges along the way. We‚Äôre sharing his summary and key takeaways for anyone who missed it!

Meet Paul, a senior software engineer on the Angular Framework Team in Munich. This #WorldSpinalCordInjuryDay Paul took some time away from contributing to one of Google‚Äôs biggest open-source projects, a framework that powers web apps like Google Cloud to share his story and advice with us:

‚ÄúI had a motorcycle accident in 2020 that caused a severe spinal cord injury. I then started physical therapy and left the hospital with a wheelchair. I'm working hard to re-activate my muscles so that I can stand up and walk with assistance. This was a life-changing situation.

Traveling with a spinal cord injury was scary at the beginning. Most of my team is located in the United States, so my job requires traveling occasionally. When I did eventually need to travel, Google supported me greatly, by allowing my brother to join and make sure I felt good. He was able to bring a larger walking device and my braces.

Google also ensured I had the proper setup at home - an ergonomic chair with back support and a standing desk, so I can stand up during meetings, reduce sitting time, and increase overall well-being.

One of the important aspects of a spinal cord injury I'd like to emphasize is the willingness to improve. You may be getting told numerous times that it's most likely no function will improve after X amount of time. I believe that you should continue to focus on working out; that doesn't necessarily mean working out physically, but can also mean focusing on your mind to connect to your impacted body parts. It's a great feeling, and from my experience can improve things drastically.‚Äù

Learn more about #LifeAtGoogle, our benefits, and our employee resource group, the Disability Alliance ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4egHtJJ

The launch of Expressive Captions on #Android uses AI to upgrade how captions are displayed by showing the nuances of language and sound. If you turn on captions for everything like I do, Expressive Captions show not just what, but also how something is being said. This is just another example of how we‚Äôre using AI to create truly helpful experiences on Android first.

Congratulations to Angana Ghosh and all the teams that came together and worked on this launch. We‚Äôre just getting started!

facebook.post_text: For the first time in a decade, Microsoft‚Äôs 3 CEOs are on stage together again.

Today we celebrate 50 years of Microsoft. üéâ

Bill Gates and Paul Allen's vision in 1975 transformed how we live, work, and play. As we enter the next 50 years, our mission to empower everyone continues because the future is shaped by those who dare to dream and create. Here's to what's next! #Microsoft50

Microsoft Bob, launched in 1995, introduced an innovative "Social Interface" and its iconic cartoon assistant, Rover. While it required advanced hardware at the time, its influence lives on in task wizards and virtual assistants like Clippy and Cortana. üìé 

But did you know it also sparked the creation of one of the most recognizable fonts in the world? In 1994, Vincent Connare, working on Microsoft Bob, noticed something odd‚ÄîRover the dog was "speaking" in Times New Roman. But dogs don‚Äôt talk in Times New Roman, he thought. So, he set out to design something more casual, friendly, and hand-drawn. That‚Äôs how Comic Sans was born, proving nearly three decades later that design isn‚Äôt just about precision‚Äîit‚Äôs about personality. 

Read more: https://msft.it/6001qUPYB #Microsoft50

Games evolve. Memories are made. But the feeling never changes. As we celebrate our 50th anniversary, we honor the gamechangers and trailblazers ‚Äì all of you who do incredible things and push the boundaries of play for all. üéÆ #Microsoft50

Throwback to ‚Äò95! Windows 95 and Office 95 helped break down walls between applications, connected users to the fledgling internet, and revolutionized computing. #Microsoft50

Microsoft 365

It‚Äôs 2003, and we‚Äôre on the move! Windows Mobile brought Microsoft Office, Internet Explorer, and Outlook to your pocket, revolutionizing productivity on the go. Our 2010 partnership with Nokia introduced Windows Phone, featuring capacitive touchscreens and high-resolution displays. While we‚Äôre no longer in the mobile phone OS business, our dedication to productivity from anywhere continues. #Microsoft50

twitter.post_text: Since implementing a Microsoft Teams Agent for more than 35,000 bankers across 4,000 branches, Wells Fargo has cut response times for internal questions from 10 minutes down to 30 seconds. Now more than 1,700 procedural questions can be answered using AI.

Ever wondered what a satellite would say if it could speak? üì°

Meet Hera, Europe‚Äôs asteroid-defending spacecraft, with a voice powered by Azure OpenAI. She‚Äôs got one mission: protect Earth. And now, she‚Äôs talking about it. https://t.co/Tt4s8AzjR7
A new study shows that advanced cooling tech can cut emissions by 15% and water consumption by 50%. Learn more about how we‚Äôre rethinking datacenter cooling. https://t.co/PmIqzTsh1Y
AI trailblazer on the bench: A Colombian judge leads judicial transformation using Microsoft Copilot to speed up justice and reduce the backlog of cases. https://t.co/zlQdkNay24
A father's determination led to the creation of an AI tool that is helping families worldwide get accurate diagnoses faster. https://t.co/LAyiasgT4V

instagram.post_text: Researcher, wellness educator, and children‚Äôs book author‚Äî @wellbyshania really can do it all. ‚ú® In episode 3 of the Changemakers Tour, learn how she‚Äôs using creativity (and a lot of heart) to make health more accessible, one page at a time.
